result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael W Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
DNA and Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.
Court does NOT grant expungement.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael W Schultz in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date for plea/sentencing. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Michael W Schultz in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense does not have discovery at this time. Court will give another date in 30 days. Defense to advise on the next date how they will proceed.  Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Michael W Schultz in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
